title: Senior Software Engineer - Quality Management
content:
Precisely is the leader in data integrity. We empower businesses to make more confident decisions based on trusted data through a unique combination of software, data enrichment products and strategic services. What does this mean to you? For starters, it means joining a company focused on delivering outstanding innovation and support that helps customers increase revenue, lower costs and reduce risk. In fact, Precisely powers better decisions for more than 12,000 global organizations, including 99 of the Fortune 100. Precisely's 2500 employees are unified by four company core values that are central to who we are and how we operate: Openness, Determination, Individuality, and Collaboration. We are committed to career development for our employees and offer opportunities for growth, learning and building community. With a "work from anywhere" culture, we celebrate diversity in a distributed environment with a presence in 30 countries as well as 20 offices in over 5 continents. Learn more about why it's an exciting time to join Precisely!Intro and job overview: As a Senior Software Engineer in Test, you are responsible for the design, creation, and maintenance of automated test frameworks. A candidate should possess the ability to perform API, UI, functional, regression, smoke, exploratory and end to end testing within an agile delivery model. As a member of a global scrum team, design, implement and test new functionality for the Data Integration SaaS products. This position will allow Precisely to expand features and functions of Data Integration products and launch a managed cloud offering.
Responsibilities and Duties:
Design, create and maintain automated test frameworks for front and back end systems/applications.
Perform API, UI functional, regression, exploratory, and end to end testing within an agile delivery model. 
Demonstrate good understanding of Continuous Integration process, and should be able to create and execute jobs pipeline (GitlabCI/Jenkins).
Develop/document test plans, automated framework, tests for SAAS applications based on docker /Kubernetes running in Cloud.
Test in bigdata environments like Databricks, Spark etc
Requirements and Qualifications: 
Strong programming/scripting experience and a passion for Developing test code.
5+ years exp in Test Automation including planning, assessments, script development and maintenance. 
Proven experience in scripting (shell, batch), familiarity with Python with added advantage.
Demonstrated knowledge on framework creation in API automation with tools like rest assured, JMeter, SoapUI experience preferred.
Demonstrated knowledge with CI/CD tools like Gitlab CI/Jenkins pipeline is an added advantage. Working knowledge of infrastructure as code.
Knowledge testing SAAS applications based on docker /Kubernetes running in Cloud (AWS, Azure).
Familiarity with distributed systems/applications, and scaled system/service architecture.
Demonstrated communication skills in a stakeholder facing environment.
Demonstrated experience working within an agile and DevOps delivery team.
Must be self-directed, resilient, and creative.
#LI-SR1

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

demographic_questions.description: We are required to compile the following information for statistical purposes in order to comply with certain federal regulations relating to Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action requirements. The information you provide is strictly on a voluntary basis, and the content of the information will not affect your eligibility for employment. Likewise, if you choose not to provide this information it will not affect your eligibility for employment in any way.

answer_options.label: Hispanic or Latino - A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.
White (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.
Black or African American (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.

Asian (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent, including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands,

American Indian or Alaska Native (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America ), and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.

Two or More Races (not Hispanic or Latino) - A person who identifies with more than one of the following, as defined above: White; Black or African American; Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander; Asian; or American Indian or Alaska Native.

questions.label: Do you think of yourself as:
Are you legally authorized to work in the country in which you're applying for?

Do you now, or will you in the future, require a visa or any type of immigration sponsorship for work authorization in the country you are working from (e.g., H-1B, OPT, F1, dependent visa)?  (if hired, verification will be required consistent with federal law.)

If you answered yes to the above question, you have now or will require future immigration sponsorship, please state the type visa or sponsorship you have now or will require along with the expiration date of current status.
Do you have any relatives employed by this organization?
How did you hear about us?
